metadata.title: USN-4320-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerability
metadata.description: Al Viro discovered that the vfs layer in the Linux kernel contained a use- after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information (kernel memory).  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4320-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-4.4.0-1065-aws - 4.4.0-1065.69 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro  linux-image-4.4.0-177-generic - 4.4.0-177.207~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-177-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-177.207~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-177-lowlatency - 4.4.0-177.207~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-177-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-177.207~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-177-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-177.207~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-177-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-177.207~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-177-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-177.207~14.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro  linux-image-aws - 4.4.0.1065.66 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro  linux-image-lowlatency-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.177.156 linux-image-powerpc64-smp-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.177.156 linux-image-generic-lpae-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.177.156 linux-image-powerpc64-emb-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.177.156 linux-image-generic-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.177.156 linux-image-powerpc-e500mc-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.177.156 linux-image-virtual-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.177.156 linux-image-powerpc-smp-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.177.156 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
